neighbors.name: Seventh-day Adventist Church
neighbors.claims: This parcel is owned by the Charles Town Seventh-day Adventist Church, located on Summit Point Road in Jefferson County, WV ([Adventist Directory](https://www.adventistdirectory.org/viewEntity.aspx?EntityID=15524)). The congregation has been active in the area for decades, with records of services and events dating back to the 1980s ([Spirit of Jefferson](https://sjf.stparchive.com/Archive/SJF/SJF12241998P18.php)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through the church leadership. Coordinate outreach with the pastor to address any concerns respectfully.

citations.claim: This parcel is owned by the Charles Town Seventh-day Adventist Church, located on Summit Point Road in Jefferson County, WV
citations.title: Charles Town SDA Church - Adventist Organizational Directory

citations.claim: The congregation has been active in the area for decades, with records of services and events dating back to the 1980s
citations.title: Spirit of Jefferson Farmers Advocate December 24, 1998

neighbors.name: Henry B. Davenport III & Faye B. Davenport
neighbors.claims: Henry B. Davenport III is the owner of 'Altona', a historic farm listed on the National Register of Historic Places ([Jefferson County HLC](http://jeffersoncountyhlc.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/Altona-Nomination-Packet.pdf)). The Davenport family has a long history in the county; Henry B. Davenport III successfully sued the Jefferson County Planning Commission in 1980 to secure approval for a residential subdivision on his property ([Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/west-virginia/supreme-court/1980/14199-3.html)). The family has established the Imogene Coleman Davenport Riely Memorial Scholarship at Shepherd University ([Shepherd University Foundation](https://shepherduniversityfoundation.org/search-named-funds/?cpage=20)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Historic landowner; legal history with planning

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight respect for the Davenport familyâ€™s generations in the area. Acknowledge their historic property 'Altona' and their past defense of property rights.

citations.claim: Henry B. Davenport III is the owner of 'Altona', a historic farm listed on the National Register of Historic Places
citations.title: Altona Nomination Packet

citations.claim: Henry B. Davenport III successfully sued the Jefferson County Planning Commission in 1980 to secure approval for a residential subdivision on his property
citations.title: Davenport v. Jefferson County Planning Commission

citations.claim: The family has established the Imogene Coleman Davenport Riely Memorial Scholarship at Shepherd University
citations.title: Shepherd University Foundation Named Funds

neighbors.name: Douglas B. Lutman
neighbors.claims: Douglas B. Lutman is associated with Lutman Properties LLC, a family business established in 2011 with a stated purpose of crop farming ([WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=303635)). The entity has also engaged in residential development, receiving a Consent Order from the WV DEP in 2018 regarding land disturbance for a subdivision near Mannings ([WV DEP](https://dep.wv.gov/pio/Documents/Lutman%20Properties%2C%20LLC%20Signed%20Order%208741.pdf)). The Lutman family has ties to local governance; a Charles Lutman served on the Jefferson County Planning Commission in the early 1990s ([Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/appellate-courts/F3/2/48/615844/)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Douglas Lutman via shared agricultural and development interests. Note the family's history with both farming and subdivision development.

citations.claim: Lutman Properties LLC, a family business established in 2011 with a stated purpose of crop farming
citations.title: Lutman Properties LLC - WV SOS

citations.claim: The entity has also engaged in residential development, receiving a Consent Order from the WV DEP in 2018 regarding land disturbance for a subdivision near Mannings
citations.title: WV DEP Consent Order 8741

citations.claim: a Charles Lutman served on the Jefferson County Planning Commission in the early 1990s
citations.title: L.M. Everhart Construction v. Jefferson County Planning Commission

neighbors.name: Brandt G. Turner
neighbors.claims: Brandt G. Turner has resided in Jefferson County since at least 1983, when he was recorded participating in local youth events ([Spirit of Jefferson](https://sjf.stparchive.com/Archive/SJF/SJF08041983P13.php)). No recent public records regarding development stances or prominent community roles were found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach privately to learn concerns. Maintain a neighborly one-on-one conversation.

citations.claim: Brandt G. Turner has resided in Jefferson County since at least 1983, when he was recorded participating in local youth events
citations.title: Spirit of Jefferson Farmers Advocate August 4, 1983

neighbors.name: Fonnie R. Crawford & Sylvia M. Crawford
neighbors.claims: Fonnie R. Crawford has a history of community service in Jefferson County, having served as Treasurer for the local American Red Cross chapter in the 1970s ([Spirit of Jefferson](https://sjf.stparchive.com/Archive/SJF/SJF07221971P01.php)). Sylvia M. Crawford has been a donor to the Eastern West Virginia Community Foundation ([EWVCF](https://www.ewvcf.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/EWVCF-22nd-Annual-Report.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with a personal, respectful approach. Acknowledge their long-standing presence and past community service.

citations.claim: Fonnie R. Crawford has a history of community service in Jefferson County, having served as Treasurer for the local American Red Cross chapter in the 1970s
citations.title: Spirit of Jefferson Farmers Advocate July 22, 1971

citations.claim: Sylvia M. Crawford has been a donor to the Eastern West Virginia Community Foundation
citations.title: EWVCF 22nd Annual Report
